newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's January oil products exports up 75 pct.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's January oil products exports up 75 pct.

text.p: South Korea's oil products exports jumped 75 percent to 15.4 million barrels in January against 8.8 million barrels a year-earlier period, the Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy said on Thursday.
The ministry said in a statement the nation earned $431 million through the exports, compared with $189 million a year ago.
It said growth in oil products output following refinery expansions last year boosted the exports.
The nation's refining capability rose to 2.44 million barrels per day at the end of 1996 from 1.82 million in 1995.
South Korea's crude oil imports rose 21 percent to 76.2 million barrels in January against 63 million barrels in January 1996, the ministry said.
Local refiners spent $1.78 billion in crude purchases last month compared with $1.16 billion in January 1996.
But the country's imports of oil products fell 38 percent to 13.2 million barrels from 21.3 million. The refiners paid $411 million in January versus $502 million a year before.
The ministry did not give a breakdown of products.
